record.title: EXTENSION OF MORNING BUSINESS
record.narrative:
EXTENSION OF MORNING BUSINESS -- (Senate - December 11, 2008)

[Page: S10914]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the period of morning business be extended until 6:30 p.m. tonight with Senators allowed to speak therein for up to 10 minutes each.

Of course, the Senators are always very cooperative. If, in fact, there is something that Senator McConnell and I have been able to work out, then we will ask that the person be interrupted and we will try to move forward with a unanimous consent agreement.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: I note the absence of a quorum.

record.chair: The clerk will call the roll.
The legislative clerk proceeded to call the roll.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the order for the quorum call be rescinded.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
